OverallGame

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • OverallGame.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Controller
extends java.awt.Canvas
    Controller handles everything that goes on in the game and minigames. It knows what is currently being run and printed on-screen, and is the mediator between the minigames' object classes (Model) and view class (View).
    Version:
    5/17
    Author:
    Team 7
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • start

        private void start()
        Creates the thread and calls it's start method, then sets running to true.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Joins the thread back and sets running to false.

      • run

        private void run()
        Constantly called to make the game run at 60fps. Calls the tick and render methods

      • clearML

        private void clearML()
        Removes the mouse listeners from the controller

      • tick

        private void tick()
        Handles what methods are called every tick. Depending on what the controller's gameState is set to, clear any mouse listeners, add a new one for the corresponding game, then set that game's running variable to true and run the game. If the gameState's value's running variable is set to true, call the game's tick method.

      • render

        private void render()
        Checks the gameState and depending on what it is, calls the appropriate game's render method.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
